inputs.research_area: Adolescent mental health, anxiety, and resilience mechanisms
inputs.research_context: This study investigates anxiety symptoms and resilience processes in adolescents using longitudinal behavioral, clinical, and neurobiological assessments. The project aims to identify protective and risk factors associated with mental health trajectories during adolescence.
inputs.data_types: Demographic and clinical datasets; standardized anxiety and resilience scales; behavioral task data; physiological measures (e.g., heart rate variability); derived summary variables; documentation (protocols, data dictionary, README).
inputs.data_source: IRB-approved human participant study conducted in school and clinic settings using validated assessment tools and secure research data capture platforms.
inputs.consent_status: Parental consent and adolescent assent obtained; participants provided broad consent for de-identified data sharing.
inputs.data_volume: Longitudinal multi-modal datasets collected across multiple time points; physiological data and raw task files represent the largest portion of storage.
